newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo corn futures end mixed, CBOT corn higher.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo corn futures end mixed, CBOT corn higher.

text.p: Tokyo corn futures ended mixed on Wednesday, after distant contracts recovered in the afternoon from earlier losses, local traders said.
Prices ranged from 90 yen lower to 60 yen higher, with the benchmark September 1997 contract up 50 yen at 17,960 yen per tonne. Daily volume was 42,446 lots.

Weaker CBOT corn futures overnight triggered selling from individual investors during the morning session, the traders said. But higher CBOT corn futures on Project A overnight trading and the yen's easing against the dollar encouraged investors to buy in the afternoon, they said.
